chord.project.analyses.rhs
Interface IEdge

All Known Implementing Classes:
Edge, Edge
public interface IEdge

Specification of a path edge or a summary edge in the Reps-Horwitz-Sagiv algorithm for context-sensitive dataflow analysis.

Author:
Mayur Naik (mhn@cs.stanford.edu)

Method Summary
 int canMerge(IEdge edge, boolean mustMerge)
          Determines whether the given PE or SE can merge with this edge.
 boolean mergeWith(IEdge edge)
          Merges the given PE or SE with this edge.
 

Method Detail

canMerge

int canMerge(IEdge edge,
             boolean mustMerge)
Determines whether the given PE or SE can merge with this edge. This function is always called for a pair of PEs incoming into the same program point, or a pair of SEs for the same method. The two edges can merge iff one of the following holds:
  1. RHSAnalysis.mustMerge returns true
  2. RHSAnalysis.mustMerge returns false but RHSAnalysis.mayMerge returns true; the source nodes of the two edges are identical; one of the target node subsumes another

Parameters:
edge - A PE or SE.
Returns:
  1. -1 if these two edges cannot be merged
  2. 0 if these two edges are identical
  3. 1 if these two edges can be merged, and the return value would be identical to this.
  4. 2 if these two edges can be merged, and the return value would be identical to the parameter.
  5. 3 if these two edges can be merged, but there is no info about the return value.

mergeWith

boolean mergeWith(IEdge edge)
Merges the given PE or SE with this edge. This edge is mutated but the given edge is not. This function is called only if canMerge returns a value >= 0. The source nodes of this edge and the given edge are assumed to be identical.

Parameters:
edge - A PE or SE.
Returns:
true iff this edge changes due to the merge.
